page.title: 09PRIDDY POOLS
page.content: There are a number of disused wash pools which were used in connection with the lead mining industry in this area. Today they are known as Priddy Pools. The pools now attract anglers. The most common fish to be found are carp, rudd and perch. In very cold winters the pools freeze over and local people go skating on them. Although they are no deeper than five feet, skating is not encouraged because there is always the danger of someone falling through the ice. The ponds also play host to a wide variety of insect life. The most spectacular being the Dragonflies. The Pools are very popular with local people as a place to walk or have pic-nics.
